fields.description: In JIRA, we need to add a new plugin type for navbars.  This will allow us to move our devsuite navbar code into a plugin.

fields.description: In JIRA, a plugin can contribute to the documentation for link syntax.  We need to add help docs that explain how to use the applinks link syntax
fields.summary: Add help information for applinks link syntax in JIRA

fields.description: While there is a job that calculates an account's disk quota usage, we don't display that value to the customer.
fields.summary: Display disk quota usage in account view

fields.description: We need functional and integration test harnesses for JIRA plugins and JIRA studio at large.  This task is to investigate how difficult they would be to put in place.
fields.summary: Investigate functional and integration test harnesses

fields.description: The navbar prototype in Fisheye needs to be fully integrated into the application.
fields.summary: Integrate navbar into fisheye

fields.description:
* Take JIRA URL from project or plugin config.
* Fix authentication to JIRA.

fields.description:
* Take JIRA URL from project or plugin config.
* Allow user to just enter the name of the shared filter, instead of the URL. Or alternatively enter permalink.
* Fix authentication to JIRA. CONF-2711, CONF-4023, CONF-1595, CONF-3729 CONF-2478, CONF-5563 (Support cross-app authentication.)
* Allow further customization of columns, including custom fields. CONF-2407, CONF-6878, CONF-6091, CONF-8839,
* Add paging support for long results.
* Allow dynamic sorting of results. CONF-967
fields.summary: Update JIRA Issues Macro (Confluence)

fields.description: Take Subversion URL from the applinks configuration (via Fisheye)
fields.summary: Bundle the Snippet plugin for Confluence

fields.description:
* Description: Displays listing of recently updated pages in Confluence space on the JIRA dashboard.
* Notes: rather than focusing on a generalized RSS portlet, we will build specific portlets for each specific use.
* Take Confluence URL from project or plugin config.
* Supports cross-app authentication.
fields.summary: Create JIRA Confluence Recently Updated Portlet (JIRA)

fields.description:
* Take Confluence URL from project or plugin config.
    * Allow user to enter "SPACE:Page Name".
    * Support cross-app authentication.
fields.summary: Update JIRA Confluence Content Plugin (JIRA)

fields.description:
* Take Fisheye URL from project or plugin config.
    * Add links to Crucible reviews.
    * Protect Fisheye configuration under site admin permission.
    * Needs a screenshot icon.
    * Support cross-app authentication.
fields.summary: Update JIRA FishEye plugin

fields.description:
Utilizing Studio link sytax, the Link Toolbar inserts JIRA, Confluence, FishEye, or Crucible links in Confluence or JIRA.

Spec link forthcoming.
fields.summary: Create Link Toolbar Plugin

fields.description:
Jira studio should use cross product authentication. 
When creating new Jira project, studio should use same user to create confluence space.
fields.summary: Cross product authentication - use jira user credentials when accessing confluence

fields.description:
When trying to access the DSG account with the following URL, a blank page will be returned:

   https://www.onconfluence.com/account/admin/browseusers.action?key=DSG

However, if the key is entered in lowercase the page works as expected. 

   https://www.onconfluence.com/account/admin/browseusers.action?key=dsg

The case should be ignored since all account keys are lower cased upon creation.
fields.summary: Account key appears to be case sensitive in Account Administration

fields.description: The account key is not referred to correctly.
fields.summary: Removing space from account in global account administration broken

fields.description: The styles for the rich text editor don't seem to be available when the hosted theme is selected as the global default.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor styles are not available with Hosted Theme as a global default
Upgrade Seraph in Confluence

fields.description:
The following are either bugs or possible issues:
= Account Administration =
* Cancel account creation form sends to bad page ##
* If user created and no user groups exist, should send back to browse users page
* Can change account name to blank ##
* No way to edit users when browsing members of a group (not critical, but just annoying)
* Can change user name or email to blank and get bad page ##
* Reactivating user sends to edit user group page, when should be sent to browse users page ##
* Can create a group with no name ##
* When a group is created, should the creator user really automatically be a member of the group?
* Why can you invite users to no groups?  Should the account user group even be selectable here? (I'm thinking not) ##
* Click on "Return to browse users" from invite screen goes to bad page ##
* Default group description in browse groups should mention it cannot be removed

= Accounts in Global Admin =
* When creating an account, the user group created doesn't have use confluence permissions
* Created accounts have no home space

I've marked the blocking issues with ## but they should all probably be addressed at some point.
fields.summary: Fix issues discovered in the blitz testing

fields.description: We need a way to manually expire and restore accounts, mainly for testing purposes.
fields.summary: Add ability to manually expire and restore accounts

fields.description:
In testing, the following issues have been discovered:
* In Accounts admin, trying to add a space to an account that doesn't exist doesn't display any sort of message, error or otherwise.  The post just returns to the same page.
* In the above page, there should be some sort of instructions because it seems like it creates a space, but all it really does is associate it with the space group
* When creating a space, accounts created from the Accounts Admin don't show up in the Space Group list
* The "Accounts Admin" link on the dashboard shows up for one of my old accounts, but when I click on it, it says operation not permitted
* On the edit account details screen in the global Accounts Admin, the active checkbox has a label of 'active.name'
* If you create a space as an admin, then associate that space with an account, for some reason, the creator value is null because the cell in the spaces table is completely empty
* The "invite" link in the Account Admin screen is broken (account name not put into url correctly)
* Cannot add user to an account in the Account Admin.  The submit sends to a blank doadduser page, and when the Browse Users screen is brought up again, the user isn't there.
fields.summary: Fix hosted plugins issues

fields.description: The hosted build currently fails from the command line, and many tests don't compile.
fields.summary: Fix maven 2 build and unit tests

fields.description: There are few problems with the account information screen. The biggest being that customers are not granted a license, so we just cant refer to their 'license'. Doing so puts us in a dubious legal state where customers might reasonably demand that they are entitled a license as a result of that screen.
fields.summary: Change Naming of Account Information Labels

fields.description:
1) Update the *Administrator's Guide*:
New tab in 'Account Administration': 'Account' tab shows Account Details and allows you to change the account name
* New page: Viewing account and license details. Page created: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CSH/Viewing+account+and+license+details - UNHIDE AT LAUNCH
* New page: Changing account name.  Page created: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CSH/Changing+your+account+name - UNHIDE AT LAUNCH
* Update page: 'Administering your account' - link to the above two pages. TO DO AT LAUNCH.
* Update page: 'Using your Dashboard' - add new function to the description of 'account administration'. TO DO AT LAUNCH.
* Confirm significance of 'Account Name' and 'Key' - may need to update page 'Working with space groups' and page 'Viewing account and license details'.  ANSWERED - significance not yet clear. See new issue http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-131.
* Confirm license types - may need to update page 'Viewing account and license details'. ANSWERED - field removed from screen.

2) New plugin to add to list of installed plugins in FAQ: 'Social Bookmarking' plugin. TO DO AT LAUNCH.
fields.summary: Documentation for new Account Details screen and Confluence 2.6 upgrade

fields.description:
We used to use the following url format for the account administration:

/browseusers.action?account=account_key

This caused problems on other actions when we used "key" as a parameter name. To make it consistent and ease development in the future we should change all parameter names to "key"
fields.summary: Make hosted admin urls consistent

fields.description: We need to go through each navbar link in every product and ensure the links are what we want.
fields.summary: Navbar link review

fields.description: The results from the log file analysis need to be blogged on the HS space.
fields.summary: Blog log file analysis results

fields.description: We need a plan for monitoring Confluence Hosted and JIRA Studio that includes things we can do in the short term, medium term, and long term.  The goal is to better prepare for when we need to keep track of tens, if not hundreds of servers, and monitor more than just uptime.
fields.summary: Create short/medium/long range plan for hosted monitoring

fields.description: We should remove all usage of hosted-support@atlassian.com from HAMS.
fields.summary: Remove hosted-support@atlassian.com from HAMS

fields.description: Allow users to change account name via the account administration.

fields.description: null
fields.summary: Update Hosted theme with Confluence 2.6 styles

fields.summary: Connect Fisheye navbar to applinks plugin

fields.summary: Create applinks plugin version for Fisheye

fields.description: The navbar needs to be integrated into Fisheye/Crucible, but don't bother hooking it up to other apps yet.
fields.summary: Implement navbar prototype in Fisheye/Crucible

fields.description: When you create an instance or association in one application, the plugin should automatically try to synchronize with the target application.
fields.summary: Applinks plugins need two-way synchronization

fields.summary: Add RPC interface for all applinks plugins

fields.description: The Confluence version of the navbar should use the JIRA logo, project list, and title.
fields.summary: Change Confluence navbar to use JIRA logo, project list, and title

fields.description: We need a new JIRA plugin that allows admins to manage Subversion authorization.  Spec to follow.
fields.summary: New JIRA plugin to manage Subversion authorizations

fields.description: Just like we have in jira, content links should be pluggable in Confluence.
fields.summary: Make ContentLinkRenderers pluggable in Confluence

fields.description: Just like we did in JIRA, Confluence should have a plugin type for rendercomponents
fields.summary: Make RenderComponents pluggable in Confluence

fields.description: If a space/project/repository has no space/project/repository associations, when you click their respective Issues, Wiki, Source buttons in the navbar, you should be taken to the dashboard of the target application, but be presented with an informational box saying something like "Cannot find an assocated space/key/repository.  Click here to make an association".
fields.summary: Better handle projects/spaces/repositories with no associations

fields.description: The instance management screen in the applinks plugin should only be editable by site admins.
fields.summary: Change instance management to only be accessible by site admins

fields.description:
Mike found the following issues:
* Find issue should be Find Issues
* Logout should be two words
* No search go button
fields.summary: Implement milestone 1 review tweaks

fields.description:
The tabs currently link to the Dashboard of the application if no project is associated with it, but the appearance of the tabs is the same as if a project was available. 

To avoid confustion for the customer, we should display the tab in a different color if no project is associated to the application. 

Requirements: 
We will need access to the project linking application from each application or distribute the data to each application. Since we agreed that duplicate data is bad, lets make this part of Jira accessible via the remote interface. 

* Make Jira project linking accessible via remote interface
* Add method to AppLinking module to check for existing project in the other application based on the project key in the current application

Potential problems:
* What happens if for example the space associated with the project gets deleted? 

The remote interface for the project administration has to be a little more comprehensive. We should consider allowing the other applications to add and change project associations. For example if a space gets deleted, we will have to catch the event and send a remote call to Jira to disassociated the space from the project. 

The estimate does not include the work on the project management remote interface.
fields.summary: Disable tabs in navigation bar if no project is associated with the tab

fields.description: The devsuite navbar requires a version of prototype that is later than the one that ships with confluence.  We should temporarily convert the navbar to use mootools until Confluence upgrades their dependency.
fields.summary: Remote prototype from navbar

fields.description: Mike and Scott requested that our navbar use Prototype to avoid Javascript library proliferation.  However, the version Confluence ships with right now doesn't work with our navbar, so they will need to upgrade.  Once they upgrade, we should change our library to use Prototype instead of Mootools.
fields.summary: Change navbar to use Prototype when it has been upgraded in Confluence

fields.description: We need decent scripts to help set up a dev environment
fields.summary: Create useful dev setup environment

fields.description: I need to document how to set up a devsuite development environment, including jira, confluence, and fisheye.
fields.summary: Document devsuite development environment

fields.description: We need to merge our branch with JIRA trunk to get the new changes for the renderer component factory plugin type.
fields.summary: Merge with JIRA trunk to get new render component factories plugin type

fields.description: Plugin the navigation bar into Confluence might be a little bit more complex then the Jira integration. But the advantage is that we will be able to do it completely as a plugin.
fields.summary: Integrate Navigation bar into Confluence

fields.description: the page template for new spaces still includes a link to the now-dead Evaluation Resource space.
fields.summary: Update Hosted Account template page

fields.description: In JIRA trunk, there is a plugin operation plugin type that the applinks plugin should use to display application settings.
fields.summary: Update jira applinks plugin to use new plugin operation module

fields.description:
We will need to modify JIRA to limit the number of users based on service type purchased, and allow them to purchase more users on the fly.

Eg. a customer purchases a 10-user service; when they try to add the 11th, they are blocked, and allowed to upgrade via a secure link.

Anton says we can't do via a plugin, unfortunately.
fields.summary: Create the ability to limit JIRA users based on purchase type

fields.description:
To migrate users and groups from try.atlassian.com to onconfuence.com we will need to be able to change the group names. 

Example:

When a customer creates a trial account called AtlassianTest, all his groups will be prefixed with "atlassiantest-". But often users  would like to change the account name when they migrate to onconfluence, in this case to "Atlassian". This means that we will also have to change the group prefix to be "atlassian-", otherwise the groups will not be associated with the account. 

The estimation includes the deployment of the plugin.
fields.summary: Renaming for groups in the Remote Import plugin

fields.description: I need to write a document that describes the process of how Hosted with interact and integrate with other Atlassian products, mainly Confluence and JIRA.
fields.summary: Document Hosted Integration process with other Atlassian products

fields.description: We need to write a technical specification for the Subversion repository manager application
fields.summary: Write specification for Subversion repository manager

fields.description: Whenever a JIRA project is created, we should automatically create a subversion tree, fisheye repository, and a Confluence space
fields.summary: Create a Confluence space and a Fisheye/SVN repository for new JIRA projects

fields.description: The JIRA and Confluence applink plugins only allow simple links but don't hook into the more complex [somelink] syntax supported by both applications.  It should be possible to not only write source:foo.xml, but also [Foo Configuration|source:foo.xml] as a nice labeled link.
fields.summary: Content links for Confluence and JIRA links

fields.description: The Confluence applinks manager needs remote methods to allow JIRA to add/remove relationships automatically.
fields.summary: Add XML-RPC/SOAP methods to Confluence applinks plugin

fields.description: The license information is buried several clicks into the space.  In addition, it isn't possible to find the account id, which is important for Administrative tasks.
fields.summary: Better display account information in Confluence

fields.description: When an account has expired and then is restored, the user and group permissions are not restored, requiring an Atlassian staff to try to restore them manually.
fields.summary: Expired spaces that are restored aren't having user and group permissions restored

fields.description: The current expiration for commercial Confluence Hosted customers happens too quickly, particularly for those that are resolving credit card issues.  We should extend this grace period from 3 to 18 days.
fields.summary: Don't expire commercial spaces till 15 days after their expiration

fields.description:
Using Jed's log tool analytics tool, perform analytics on all Confluence Hosted logs and determine pages/operations that experience delays.

https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/tools/atlassian-log-analysis/trunk
fields.summary: Perform access log analytics

fields.description:
SER-72 - needs to be resolved to change Confluence Hosted to selective SSL (only use SSL for login, password change, etc.)

The app server sets the secure flag on the session cookie if SSL is in effect.

Seraph should behave similarly when generating the seraph.os.cookie.

The secure flag indicates to the browser to only transmit the cookie when SSL is in effect:

http://www.w3.org/Security/Faq/wwwsf2.html
fields.summary: Fix Seraph issue that prevents using selective SSL with Confluence

fields.description:
The crowd SSO connector currently makes a validation call to the crowd server to verify the authentication token for every request.  The connector is configurable so that you can have it only verify the token every x minutes, but then you lose immediate logout.  

The resolution is to modify the crowd connector to simply delete the authentication cookie on logout.
fields.summary: Improve performance of Crowd SSO

fields.description:
Please add the Checklists Plugin for use in Confluence.

Link:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Checklists+Plugin
fields.summary: CLONE -Request to add "Checklist" macro to Confluence

fields.description: Currently an exception is thrown when the remote import fails for one space. If the administrator chooses to import a spacegroup, importing will not be continued after the import failed for one space. Instead we should continue to import the other spaces and present a list of spaces that couldn't be migrated successfully at the end of the migration.
fields.summary: Don't stop remote import of spaces if a single space can not be imported.

fields.summary: Upgrade YUI in Jira

fields.summary: Integrate navbar into JIRA

fields.description: The navbar prototype needs to be tested on all applicable browsers and reviewed to have the desired look and functionality
fields.summary: Finish Navbar prototype

fields.description: All links where we provide the hosted-support@atlassian.com address we need to change to point the user to SAC.
fields.summary: Change all links to hosted-support@atlassian.com to sac

fields.description: AOD-58 was closed on August 2nd with the statement from Jen that Confluence 2.6 would be arriving in a couple of weeks and that is why the fix that had been identified would not be installed.  By my calculations a couple of weeks from August 2 is equal to 14 days and that would have put the upgrade at August 16 or 17.   It is now August 28.  Do you have a definite release date for Confluence 2.6.  If that date is too far away, in the meantime, can the fix identified by Michael K. be put in place.  I would beg to disagree with Jen's statement that no major problems have been found so far.  If a page cannot be created in a Wiki is that not a major problem?  This is a major critical marketability issue.  Best regards, John
fields.summary: This links to AOD-58 which was "resolved" with the message "won't fix" but hasn't been resolved.

fields.description:
My company (VALIANTYS, Atlassian Partner in France) has several hosted spaces on Confluence Hosted by Contegix. 

We encounter many delay when logging and accessing to our confluence hosted space. 
It could takes more than 20s second to log in for example. 
We have regularly the same problem when accessing a page or editing it. 

Url is https://www.onconfluence.com/display/VALIANTYS/

This issue was created based on Support Request: CHSP-108
fields.summary: Confluence Hosted space is regularly very slow

fields.description: There are some some fixes to the RTE internationalisations in this release, would like to upgrade when we can.
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence Hosted to 2.5.5

fields.summary: Fix upgrade issue with invite plugin

fields.description: After we migrate a space from try.atlassian.com to onconfluence.com, the old space still exists on try.atlassian.com.  This means that the user will receive emails that inform them the space will be removed and urge him to purchase a commercial account.  Obviously, those emails are inappropriate and causing confusion.  They should be disabled in some way.
fields.summary: When migrating a space from try.a.c to onconf, we should at least disable try.a.c space removal email notifications

fields.description:
About the french language pack, I noticed some translations to be done :

1) the left-navigation theme has not been translated about 4 words : "page operations", "browse space", "add content" and "news operations".
This is rather simple to change : /confluence/WEB-INF/lib/leftnavigation.jar  then  /templates/leftnavigation.
then page.vmd : change "Page Operations" to "Operations de page" (for ex.)
and blog.vmd : change "News Operations" to "Operations sur les nouvelles"
and finally on /includes/navlinks.vm : change "Browse Space" to "Navigation" and "Add Content" to "Ajouter" (these are just suggestions of translation).

2) another suggestion was to modify the translation "Mon" (regarding the dashboard, translation for Spaces / "My") to "Personnel" ? again that's just a suggestion nor primordial at all.

3) there are some mistakes with the rich text. When we want to add links or images, the translation is not done correctly so i found the text {$lang_conflink_desc} and {$lang_confimage_desc} instead of "lien hypertexte" and "image". The pop-up that appears when we click on is not himself translated, with the same {$lang_conflink_destination and text} or '$lang_confimage_filename and thumbnail and alignment}. (suggestions : destination du lien, texte du lien | et nom de l'image, apparaître en vignette, alignement)

4) the language pack does not translate the text that is sent when we invite someone to join our confluence (seen on the hosted version). Anyway I saw that the function was this morning temporarly disabled, but if a translation were possible on the future, it would be nice.

5) could it be possible then to upgrade the fr-language pack for the hosted version ?

Thank you for your job, I hope the translations could be one day finalized. I'm working at the moment on a french-tutorial i would maybe post here, so such modifications can help me a lot.
Rudy LY
fields.summary: Issues for the French language pack
